$interpreted: Soldier: ... And that's the end of the message from the princess.
Hyde: Understood. Must say, certainly didn't expect the situation to unfold like this.
Soldier: Sir, what do you mean by that?
Hyde: The Twelve Nobles are all in Theodore's debt. Saying the princess has a disadvantage is a monsterous understatement.

Hyde: Even if princess's plan succeeded and she was able to activate Rayzor, it will still be a tall task for her to go up against Theodore's army.
Heavy casualties are practically guaranteed.
Soldier: Then, the unexpected development you mentioned...
Hyde: The blast from Rayzor that split the skies at the border.

Hyde: Thanks to that little showcase, the nobles whom witnessed Rayzor's destructive power first-hand are probably all trembling in fear right now. 
They won't dare to lend troops to Theodore anymore...
Soldier: S...Sir Hyde, run...
Hyde: Aww~ You don't have to be so nervous~
Soldier: Sir Hyde, now is not the right time for jokes...
Hyde: Not talking to you.
Soldier: S...Sir, how did you...!?
Hyde: Did King Theodore send you? Is there a reason why you're so angry and trying to kill me?
Ralph: Why didn't you report Angelia's actions?
Hyde: You mean her visit to Atlas?
Hyde: I didn't think they could actually activate Rayzor either. Hence why I found that information to be minor and didn't bother to report it~
Hyde: Calm down~ That absurd blast may seem like a threat, but it is instead a golden opportunity for King Theodore~
Ralph: I will give you one last chance. Speak.
Hyde: That blast has exposed Angelia's intentions.

Hyde: Her only option now is to remove the core module of Rayzor and take it back to Sunshine Infantry as soon as possible. 
She can then modify the core and turn it into a weapon.

Hyde: I know their return route and the number of escorts they will have. You keep me alive, you get to nail them all in one fell swoop. 
Great bargain if you ask me~
Ralph: I'll keep you alive, for now. However, you're no longer allowed to stay here. Come with me; this is a direct order from King Theodore.
Hyde: So this means that until everything is over, I have to be kept under your surveillance?
Hyde: Whatever, the ending to the script is already in the books anyway. Although I had fun, the "playing strategist" game comes to an end here~
